instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Macbook air
threads.message:
Hey guys just got a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>  with a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a  board in it.
It has the wrong screw in the fan where the short one goes... has anyone had this and what can It affect?

threads.title: Macbook air
threads.message:
I'm not sure what you mean.
Just got broken screw support for fan on the MLB?
Can you send a close picture?

If you talk about the smallest screw, which fixes the heatpipe on the shell, forget it; is not really needed.
Better not to fix it, or you can damage wireless antena cables.

threads.title: Macbook air
threads.message: It's the only screw that goes through the fan into a standoff on the motherboard.

threads.title: Macbook air
threads.message:
You don't have the screw at all, or what happened?
Should be good enough if fan is fixed in the other two screws.
I always change it with the smallest one from heatpipe and use the original for the logic boards when need it.
